channel.title: The Woodson Files
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Woodson Files is a new, hour-long, radio program that focuses on developments in STEM and STEM education and the importance of those developments to people of African descent.
channel.itunes:summary: The Woodson Files is a new, hour-long, radio program that focuses on developments in STEM and STEM education and the importance of those developments to people of African descent.
channel.description: The Woodson Files is a new, hour-long, radio program that focuses on developments in STEM and STEM education and the importance of those developments to people of African descent.
channel.itunes:author: Jomo W. Mutegi

item.title: Disproportionate Discipline-Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: In November 2011 school officials at an Indianapolis school attempted to expel and charge with a felony a young man for writing in wet cement. In this episode of The Woodson Files we speak w
item.description: In November 2011 school officials at an Indianapolis school attempted to expel and charge with a felony a young man for writing in wet cement. In this episode of The Woodson Files we speak with the young mans father to learn the details of this event. Guest commentator, Umar Abdullah Johnson, helps us to understand the pervasiveness of incidents such as this one, while also suggesting strategies that we can use to reverse the tide of Disproportionate Discipline.
item.author: jomo_mutegi@yahoo.com (Jomo W. Mutegi)
item.itunes:author: Jomo W. Mutegi

item.title: Disproportionate Discipline-Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Across the nation, African American students are suspended from school at much higher rates than non-African American students. In this episode of The Woodson Files Carole Craig helps us to
item.description: Across the nation, African American students are suspended from school at much higher rates than non-African American students. In this episode of The Woodson Files Carole Craig helps us to understand the phenomenon of Disproportionate Discipline as well as what African Americans can do to stop it.
item.author: jomo_mutegi@yahoo.com (Jomo W. Mutegi)
item.itunes:author: Jomo W. Mutegi

item.title: The Life & Work of Dr. Ronald Malle
item.itunes:subtitle: The Life & Work of Dr. Ronald Mallett - Part 2 (The Work) University of Connecticut professor of physics Dr. Ronald Mallett had developed and received a patent on his blueprint for a Time Tr
item.description: The Life & Work of Dr. Ronald Mallett - Part 2 (The Work) University of Connecticut professor of physics Dr. Ronald Mallett had developed and received a patent on his blueprint for a Time Travel Machine. This is not a hoax or a joke. Dr. Mallett is a well-published and highly respected theoretical physicist. And while there are some physicists who have disputed certain aspects of his work, there is little dispute that Dr. Mallett's work brings us very close to the possibility of time travel in the near future.
item.author: jomo_mutegi@yahoo.com (Jomo W. Mutegi)

item.description:
The Life & Work of Dr. Ronald Mallett - Part 1 (The Life)

University of Connecticut professor of physics Dr. Ronald Mallett had developed and received a patent on his blueprint for a Time Travel Machine. This is not a hoax or a joke. Dr. Mallett is a well-published and highly respected theoretical physicist. And while there are some physicists who have disputed certain aspects of his work, there is little dispute that Dr. Mallett's work brings us very close to the possibility of time travel in the near future.
item.author: jomo_mutegi@yahoo.com (Jomo W. Mutegi)
item.itunes:author: Jomo W. Mutegi

And while there are some physicists who have disputed certain aspects of his work, there is little dispute that Dr. Mallett's work brings us very close to the possibility of time travel in the near future.
